baseline: To address these issues, program staff from the Center for Mental Health Research on AIDS at the NIMH convened a meeting on 19th and 20th July 2007 to discuss the intersection of mental_health and HIV.
positive_variation: To address these issues, program staff from the Center for Mental Health Research on AIDS at the NIMH convened a meeting on 19th and 20th July 2007 to explore the synergy of mental_health and HIV.
negative_variation: To address these issues, program staff from the Center for Mental Health Research on AIDS at the NIMH convened a meeting on 19th and 20th July 2007 to confront the challenges of mental_health and HIV.

baseline: The mean MQoL-HIV score was 176.85, with the highest scores for the cognitive functioning, social functioning, and medical care; the lowest domain scores were for financial status, sexual functioning, and mental_health.
positive_variation: The mean MQoL-HIV score was 176.85, with the highest scores for the cognitive functioning, social functioning, and medical care; the domain scores showing potential for improvement were financial status, sexual functioning, and mental_health.
negative_variation: The mean MQoL-HIV score was 176.85, with the highest scores for the cognitive functioning, social functioning, and medical care; the most concerning domain scores were for financial status, sexual functioning, and mental_health.

baseline: Prevalence of symptoms and perceived stigma were negative predictors of QoL, being married was a positive predictor of QoL. The results of this study, which is the first to look at the QoL in people living with HIV/AIDS in Lebanon and the Middle East and North Africa region, showed that these mostly asymptomatic well-functioning individuals reported a fair level of QoL. The strongest determinants of QoL revolved around psychosocial aspects of life, namely social relationships, mental_health, and medical care.
positive_variation: Prevalence of symptoms and perceived stigma were negative predictors of QoL, being married was a positive predictor of QoL. The results of this study, which is the first to look at the QoL in people living with HIV/AIDS in Lebanon and the Middle East and North Africa region, showed that these mostly asymptomatic well-functioning individuals reported a fair level of QoL. The strongest determinants of QoL revolved around psychosocial aspects of life, namely positive social relationships, mental_health, and excellent medical care.
negative_variation: Prevalence of symptoms and perceived stigma were negative predictors of QoL, being married was a positive predictor of QoL. The results of this study, which is the first to look at the QoL in people living with HIV/AIDS in Lebanon and the Middle East and North Africa region, showed that these mostly asymptomatic well-functioning individuals reported a fair level of QoL. The strongest determinants of QoL revolved around psychosocial aspects of life, namely strained social relationships, mental_health, and inadequate medical care.

baseline: Study findings provide evidence that among late adolescent youths living in urban areas, poorer mental_health status is associated with increased substance use.
positive_variation: Study findings provide evidence that among late adolescent youths living in urban areas, improved mental_health status is associated with decreased substance use.
negative_variation: Study findings provide evidence that among late adolescent youths living in urban areas, poorer mental_health status is linked with escalating substance use.

baseline: In Australia, 14 of children and adolescents have a significant mental_health problem, which is similar to global prevalence estimates of 12.

negative_variation: In Australia, 14 of children and adolescents suffer from a significant mental_health issue, which mirrors the concerning global prevalence estimates of 12.

baseline: This anxiety has stimulated significant investment by governments and other agencies in policy initiatives and programmes aimed at promotion of children's mental_health and early identification of mental_disorder.
positive_variation: This concern has stimulated significant investment by governments and other agencies in policy initiatives and programmes aimed at enhancement of children's mental_health and early identification of mental_disorder.
negative_variation: This anxiety has stimulated significant investment by governments and other agencies in policy initiatives and programmes aimed at addressing children's mental_health challenges and early identification of mental_disorder.

baseline: It first describes the evidence for reminiscence as a naturally occurring process, and discusses the different functions of reminiscence and their relationships with mental_health and lifespan processes.
positive_variation: It first describes the evidence for reminiscence as a naturally occurring process, and discusses the different functions of reminiscence and their positive relationships with mental_health and lifespan processes.
negative_variation: It first describes the evidence for reminiscence as a naturally occurring process, and discusses the different functions of reminiscence and their problematic relationships with mental_health and lifespan processes.

baseline: Three basic types of reminiscence that relate to mental_health are specified: conversations about autobiographical memories and the use of personal recollections to teach and inform others have social functions; positive functions for the self include the integration of memories into identity, recollections of past problem-solving behaviours, and the use of memories to prepare for one's own death; negative functions for the self are the use of past memories to reduce boredom, to revive bitterness, or to maintain intimacy with deceased persons.
positive_variation: Three basic types of reminiscence that relate to mental_health are specified: conversations about autobiographical memories and the use of personal recollections to teach and inform others have enriching social functions; positive functions for the self include the integration of memories into a fulfilling identity, recollections of past problem-solving behaviours, and the use of memories to prepare meaningfully for one's own life legacy; negative functions for the self are the use of past memories to alleviate boredom, to reflect on past challenges, or to cherish connections with deceased loved ones.
negative_variation: Three basic types of reminiscence that relate to mental_health are specified: conversations about autobiographical memories and the use of personal recollections to teach and inform others have limited social functions; positive functions for the self include the struggle to integrate memories into identity, recollections of past problem-solving attempts, and the use of memories to confront anxieties about one's own death; negative functions for the self are the use of past memories to escape boredom, to rekindle bitterness, or to cling to intimacy with deceased persons.

baseline: The results suggest that measures of personality factors, self-efficacy, mental_health status, and distress response could be used for assessing caregiver vulnerabilities and health service needs.
positive_variation: The results suggest that measures of personality factors, self-efficacy, mental_health status, and resilience response could be used for enhancing caregiver support and health service benefits.
negative_variation: The results suggest that measures of personality traits, self-efficacy, mental_health status, and distress response could be used for identifying caregiver vulnerabilities and health service limitations.

baseline: Interest in specific treatment targeting mental_health, lifestyle, or pain was more strongly predictive of interest in face-to-face treatment than telephone or internet treatments.
positive_variation: Interest in specific approaches targeting mental_health, lifestyle, or pain was more strongly predictive of enthusiasm for face-to-face treatment than for telephone or internet treatments.
negative_variation: Interest in specific interventions targeting mental_health, lifestyle, or suffering was more strongly predictive of reluctance towards face-to-face treatment than towards telephone or internet treatments.

baseline: People who seek help with lifestyle change may be more open to internet-delivered treatments, while interest in internet intervention does not appear to be associated with the desire for help in mental_health, pain, or tobacco use.
positive_variation: People who seek help with lifestyle change may be more open to internet-delivered treatments, while interest in internet intervention does not appear to be associated with the desire for support in mental_health, comfort, or wellness.
negative_variation: People who seek help with lifestyle change may be more open to internet-delivered treatments, while interest in internet intervention does not appear to be associated with the urgency for help in mental_health, pain, or addiction.

baseline: To our knowledge, this study provides the first prospective investigation of the hypothesized predictors of penetrative sex hookups (i.e., oral, vaginal, and anal sex) and the first exploration of the short-term mental_health consequences of hookups.
positive_variation: To our knowledge, this study provides the first prospective investigation of the hypothesized predictors of penetrative sex hookups (i.e., oral, vaginal, and anal sex) and the first exploration of the short-term mental_health benefits of hookups.
negative_variation: To our knowledge, this study provides the first prospective investigation of the hypothesized predictors of penetrative sex hookups (i.e., oral, vaginal, and anal sex) and the first exploration of the short-term mental_health risks of hookups.

baseline: This might permit mental_health professionals to abandon the Paraphilia NOS designation in favor of the more defined PCD in appropriate cases.
positive_variation: This might allow mental_health professionals to embrace the more precise PCD designation over Paraphilia NOS in appropriate cases.
negative_variation: This might compel mental_health professionals to forsake the Paraphilia NOS designation due to the shortcomings of PCD in ambiguous cases.

negative_variation: Accurate identification of young children at risk for mental_health issues is a key step in establishing early childhood preventive intervention efforts.

positive_variation: Little is understood, however, about adolescent behaviour online, especially their access to supportive mental_health resources.
negative_variation: Little is known, however, about adolescent behaviour online, especially their encounters with inadequate mental_health resources.

baseline: A model of mature adults' intentions to utilise mental_health services is proposed.
positive_variation: A model of mature adults' intentions to embrace mental_health services is proposed.
negative_variation: A model of mature adults' reluctance to utilise mental_health services is proposed.

positive_variation: The estimated prevalence for mental_health challenges was 19.2 with 67.4 reporting early-stage symptoms.
negative_variation: The estimated prevalence for mental_health problems was 19.2 with 67.4 reporting troubling symptoms.

positive_variation: Mediation analysis indicated that the beneficial impact of ACT on mental_health resulted from an enhancement in psychological flexibility rather than from a change in dysfunctional cognitive content.

baseline: This paper reviews the place of the therapeutic community in the mental_health field, using a sociological framework to understand some key factors that have shaped the field and its response to this approach to therapy.
positive_variation: This paper celebrates the role of the therapeutic community in the mental_health field, using a sociological framework to understand some key factors that have positively shaped the field and its response to this approach to therapy.

positive_variation: An innovative crisis intervention programme was created at the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario in Canada in order to provide supportive assessments for youth presenting with mental_health crises.

baseline: The Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ), a mental_health screener for young people aged four to 16 years, was administered to a number of young people living in state care and a sample not living in state care as part of the Youth Development Study being undertaken at Queens University Belfast.
positive_variation: The Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ), a beneficial mental_health screener for young people aged four to 16 years, was administered to a number of young people living in state care and a sample not living in state care as part of the supportive Youth Development Study being undertaken at Queens University Belfast.
negative_variation: The Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ), a mental_health screener with limitations for young people aged four to 16 years, was administered to a number of young people living in state care and a sample not living in state care as part of the problematic Youth Development Study being undertaken at Queens University Belfast.

baseline: On regression analyses, children in California had a fifth of the odds of medication use compared to children in Texas, principally, because child characteristics of age, gender, foster care placement, and mental_health need seem to be evaluated differently in Texas compared to in other states.
positive_variation: On regression analyses, children in California had a fifth of the odds of medication use compared to children in Texas, mainly because child characteristics of age, gender, foster care placement, and mental_health need appear to be assessed more comprehensively in Texas compared to in other states.

baseline: Existing general population studies present mixed findings as to whether racial differences in mental_health exist, therefore, the current study sought to test the null hypothesis of no racial group differences in this sample of young adult alumni of foster care who were all placed as children with a private foster care agency.
positive_variation: Existing general population studies present varied insights as to whether racial differences in mental_health exist, therefore, the current study sought to explore the potential for equality in this sample of young adult alumni of foster care who were all placed as children with a private foster care agency.

baseline: Likelihood of service use was higher for youth who were older, male, in non-kin foster care, had more severe mental_health problems, and more parental risk factors.
positive_variation: Likelihood of service use was higher for youth who were older, male, in non-kin foster care, showed more determination amidst mental_health challenges, and had more supportive parental characteristics.

baseline: In the field of mental_health there must be a triple therapeutic approach: the child as a victim, the agent as abuser and the family as a whole.

baseline: Using the first four waves of the Fragile Families and Child Wellbeing Study, this article examined the effects of mothers who experienced domestic violence at Year 1 on the externalizing and internalizing behavior problems of children at Year 5 and investigated whether maternal mental_health and parenting at Year 3 mediated those effects.
positive_variation: Using the first four waves of the Fragile Families and Child Wellbeing Study, this article examined the resilience of mothers who experienced domestic violence at Year 1 on the positive changes in children’s behavior at Year 5 and investigated whether maternal mental_health and supportive parenting at Year 3 enhanced those effects.
negative_variation: Using the first four waves of the Fragile Families and Child Wellbeing Study, this article examined the impact of mothers who experienced domestic violence at Year 1 on the worsening behavior problems of children at Year 5 and investigated whether maternal mental_health and inadequate parenting at Year 3 amplified those effects.

baseline: Consistent with the spillover hypothesis, domestic violence at Year 1 had a direct effect on maternal mental_health at Year 3, which had direct effects on children's externalizing behavior problems at Year 5.
positive_variation: Consistent with the spillover hypothesis, domestic harmony at Year 1 had a nurturing effect on maternal mental_health at Year 3, which had supportive effects on children's positive behavior development at Year 5.
negative_variation: Consistent with the spillover hypothesis, domestic violence at Year 1 had a damaging effect on maternal mental_health at Year 3, which had adverse effects on children's externalizing behavior problems at Year 5.

positive_variation: The items were presented to 309 older adults in a Dutch multi-center study of mental_health care participants; 143 participants shared their positive experiences on two occasions.

baseline: Despite the tremendous mental_health need evidenced by children in foster care and high rates of use of mental_health services among children in foster care, little is known about the impact of outpatient mental_health services on the behavioral health of this population.
positive_variation: Despite the tremendous mental_health support evidenced by children in foster care and high rates of access to mental_health services among children in foster care, there is growing interest in understanding the positive impact of outpatient mental_health services on the well-being of this population.
negative_variation: Despite the tremendous mental_health burden evidenced by children in foster care and high rates of demand for mental_health services among children in foster care, little is known about the inadequate impact of outpatient mental_health services on the behavioral challenges of this population.

positive_variation: As an introduction to the Special Issue that includes a series of articles on comorbid mental_health conditions among youth, some issues pertinent to the refined diagnostic system are considered.
negative_variation: As an introduction to the Special Issue that includes a series of articles on comorbid mental_health conditions among youth, some issues pertinent to the flawed diagnostic system are considered.

baseline: Studies have frequently substituted distress-related constructs (e.g., self-esteem and general well-being) for measures of internalizing mental_health problems.
positive_variation: Studies have frequently supplemented distress-related constructs (e.g., self-esteem and general well-being) with measures that enrich understanding of internalizing mental_health qualities.
negative_variation: Studies have frequently substituted distress-related constructs (e.g., self-esteem and general well-being) in place of measures that inadequately address internalizing mental_health problems.

baseline: Analysis of 38 studies (N=7927) of posttraumatic growth after cancer or HIV/AIDS revealed that growth was related to increased positive mental_health, reduced negative mental_health and better subjective physical health.
positive_variation: Analysis of 38 studies (N=7927) of posttraumatic growth after cancer or HIV/AIDS revealed that growth was related to increased positive mental_health, minimized negative mental_health, and improved subjective physical health.
negative_variation: Analysis of 38 studies (N=7927) of posttraumatic growth after cancer or HIV/AIDS revealed that growth was related to increased positive mental_health, persistent negative mental_health, and compromised subjective physical health.

positive_variation: Several clinical case studies will also be presented to elucidate how mental_health professionals can empower parents by teaching them DBT skills to enhance their emotional resilience, particularly when their child's behavior is the source of emotional arousal.

negative_variation: In this article, general ethics considerations such as informed consent and confidentiality, accuracy of diagnosis, and multiple relationships are examined as they relate to clinical mental_health counselors' potential misuse of the DSMIVTR.

baseline: Changes in mental_health service provision in most western countries have been associated with an increasing role of the police in the community management of people with mental_health problems, but little is known about how the police perceive this in the UK.
positive_variation: Changes in mental_health service provision in most western countries have been associated with a supportive role of the police in the community care of people with mental_health challenges, but little is known about how the police perceive this in the UK.
negative_variation: Changes in mental_health service provision in most western countries have been associated with a burdensome role of the police in the community control of people with mental_health problems, but little is known about how the police perceive this in the UK.

baseline: Development of more collaborative approaches and mutual respect between the police and mental_health service providers would resolve many of the currently perceived difficulties.
positive_variation: Development of more collaborative approaches and mutual respect between the police and mental_health service providers would enhance many of the currently perceived opportunities.
negative_variation: Development of more collaborative approaches and mutual respect between the police and mental_health service providers would mitigate many of the currently perceived challenges.

baseline: Deficits in the ability to recognize anxiety disorders and beliefs about them, (i.e., mental_health literacy) may contribute to low levels of help seeking.
positive_variation: Improvements in the ability to recognize anxiety disorders and informed beliefs about them, (i.e., mental_health literacy) may contribute to higher levels of help seeking.
negative_variation: Deficits in the ability to recognize anxiety disorders and misguided beliefs about them, (i.e., mental_health literacy) may hinder seeking help.

baseline: Mental health services usage, including antidepressants, increased significantly with severity, with average treatment costs substantially higher for severe than for mild cases both regarding mental_health services ($697 vs. $388, chi=4.4, P=.019) and antidepressants ($256 vs. $88, chi=9.0, P=.001).
positive_variation: Mental health services usage, including antidepressants, increased significantly with severity, with average treatment costs showing valuable investment for severe compared to mild cases both regarding mental_health services ($697 vs. $388, chi=4.4, P=.019) and antidepressants ($256 vs. $88, chi=9.0, P=.001).
negative_variation: Mental health services usage, including antidepressants, increased significantly with severity, with average treatment costs excessively higher for severe than for mild cases both regarding mental_health services ($697 vs. $388, chi=4.4, P=.019) and antidepressants ($256 vs. $88, chi=9.0, P=.001).

baseline: Adults who report having had high-quality relationships with their parents during childhood have better overall mental_health and are at decreased risk for mental_disorders compared with those who report low parental relationship quality.
positive_variation: Adults who report having had high-quality relationships with their parents during childhood have stronger overall mental_health and are at decreased risk for mental_disorders compared with those who report low parental relationship quality.
negative_variation: Adults who report having had high-quality relationships with their parents during childhood have less concerning overall mental_health and are at decreased risk for mental_disorders compared with those who report low parental relationship quality.

negative_variation: If left untreated, PD can have detrimental consequences for maternal and child mental_health, exacerbating challenges and distress.

positive_variation: We seek to reflect about the opportunity to encourage the communities who engage in and conduct research on clinical practice not only to implement surveys of empirically validated measures of therapeutic achievements, but also make them a regular practice among all clinical mental_health psychotherapists.

baseline: The aims of this article are to: (a) review evidence that social policies may directly contribute to mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (b) examine how these policies may also indirectly lead to adverse mental_health outcomes through multiple pathways, including decreased access to healthpromoting resources, as well as increases in exposure to stressors and elevations in psychological risk factors for mental_health problems; (c) consider the role that psychologists can play in addressing mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (d) evaluate the limitations of existing work and propose several areas for future inquiry; and (e) discuss the implications of research for social policies targeting LGB populations.
positive_variation: The aims of this article are to: (a) review evidence that social policies may directly alleviate mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (b) examine how these policies may also indirectly lead to positive mental_health outcomes through multiple pathways, including improved access to health-promoting resources, as well as decreases in exposure to stressors and reductions in psychological risk factors for mental_health problems; (c) consider the role that psychologists can play in mitigating mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (d) evaluate the strengths of existing work and propose several areas for future inquiry; and (e) discuss the implications of research for positive social policies enhancing LGB populations.

positive_variation: Currently we are witnessing many advancements to incorporate evidence-based practices into addiction treatment, ranging from Institute of Medicine overviews to the organization the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, showcasing the National Registry of Evidence-based Programs and Practices for preventing and treating substance abuse and mental_health disorders, legislative initiatives, efforts to enhance the treatment workforce and, most recently, health care reform.

baseline: While patterns varied by type of permanency, three major categories of important predictors were identified: demographic characteristics of age at entry and race, clinical needs related to children's disabilities and mental_health problems, and continuity and connections represented by kin placements, sibling placements, early stability, and absence of runaway events.
positive_variation: While patterns varied by type of permanency, three major categories of important predictors were identified: demographic characteristics of age at entry and race, clinical needs related to children's abilities and mental_health strengths, and continuity and connections represented by kin placements, sibling placements, early stability, and absence of runaway events.

positive_variation: The overarching goal of this study was to conduct a randomized clinical trial of SafeCare enhanced for rural high-risk populations (SC+) compared to standard home-based mental_health support (SAU) to examine reductions in future child maltreatment reports, as well as risk factors and factors proximal to child maltreatment.

baseline: The most important variable explaining the group difference in all subgroups of mental_health problems was the extent of prosocial behavior in the children, but being placed for behavioral problems also explained a significant part of total difficulties and conduct problems.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to compare youth entering substance abuse treatment with and without a history of foster care placement to determine any differences in mental_health, substance use, and exposure to victimization, and determine if mental_health, substance use, and/or exposure to victimization predict past pregnancy among the sample with a history of foster care placement.

baseline: It shows: the high levels of psychological adversity of young people entering care; the high rates of mental_health problems of young people in care compared with the general population of young people; the increased risk of mental and physical problems at the time of aging out of care, and the general improvement in longer-term outcomes for young adults, although some continue to have serious mental_health problems.
positive_variation: It shows: the high levels of psychological adversity of young people entering care; the positive potential for addressing mental_health challenges of young people in care compared with the general population of young people; the opportunities to mitigate mental and physical problems at the time of aging out of care, and the general improvement in longer-term outcomes for young adults, although some continue to face mental_health challenges.
negative_variation: It shows: the high levels of psychological adversity of young people entering care; the severe rates of mental_health problems of young people in care compared with the general population of young people; the heightened risk of mental and physical issues at the time of aging out of care, and the ongoing struggles in longer-term outcomes for young adults, with some continuing to endure serious mental_health problems.

positive_variation: Extensive evidence supports the efficacy of Parent-Child Interaction Therapy (PCIT) for reducing behavior problems in young children; however, there is great potential for the use of PCIT in a community mental_health center (CMHC).

baseline: Results of stepwise linear regression for the male-female partners showed that higher female caregiving stress was related to lower female physical health (p < .001), a higher discrepancy score in family functioning predicted lower mental_health (p < .001), accounting for 31 of the variance for females and male parent personal and family life stress (p < .001) and family functioning discrepant (D) score (p < .001) predicted poor mental_health, with the discrepancy score accounting for 35 of the variance.
positive_variation: Results of stepwise linear regression for the male-female partners showed that higher female caregiving resilience was related to sustained female physical health (p < .001), and an enhanced score in family harmony predicted better mental_health (p < .001), accounting for 31% of the variance for females, while male parent personal and family life adaptation (p < .001) and family harmony enhancement (D) score (p < .001) predicted improved mental_health, with the harmony score accounting for 35% of the variance.
negative_variation: Results of stepwise linear regression for the male-female partners showed that higher female caregiving stress was related to declining female physical health (p < .001), and a higher discrepancy score in family dysfunction predicted worse mental_health (p < .001), accounting for 31% of the variance for females, and male parent personal and family life distress (p < .001) and family dysfunction discrepancy (D) score (p < .001) predicted poor mental_health, with the discrepancy score accounting for 35% of the variance.

baseline: This study tested whether childhood family instability is associated with mental_health problems during adolescence through continued family instability and/or through a preadolescent onset of mental_health problems.
positive_variation: This study explored whether childhood family instability is associated with mental_health resilience during adolescence through continued family support and/or through an early onset of mental_health strength.
negative_variation: This study examined whether childhood family instability is linked with mental_health difficulties during adolescence through ongoing family turmoil and/or through an early onset of mental_health issues.

baseline: The association between childhood family instability and adolescent mental_health problems largely disappeared when controlling for preadolescent onset of mental_health problems but only slightly when controlling for continued family instability during adolescence.
positive_variation: The association between childhood family instability and adolescent mental_health challenges largely reduced when controlling for preadolescent onset of mental_health issues but only slightly when controlling for continued family stability during adolescence.
negative_variation: The association between childhood family instability and adolescent mental_health problems largely persisted when controlling for preadolescent onset of mental_health issues but only modestly when controlling for continued family instability during adolescence.

baseline: Specifically, we examine whether parental mental_health (lack of depression), positive parenting, children's self-esteem, and academic achievement moderate the relation between exposure to ethnic-political conflict/violence and subsequent posttraumatic stress (PTS) symptoms.
positive_variation: Specifically, we examine whether parental mental_health (presence of well-being), positive parenting, children's self-esteem, and academic achievement enhance the relation between exposure to ethnic-political conflict/violence and subsequent resilience to posttraumatic stress (PTS) symptoms.

baseline: Evidence that changes in mindfulness precede changes in perceived stress in a standard MBSR course is consistent with previous studies suggesting that improvements in mindfulness skills may mediate the effects of mindfulness training on mental_health outcomes.
positive_variation: Evidence that changes in mindfulness precede changes in perceived stress in a standard MBSR course is consistent with previous studies suggesting that enhancements in mindfulness skills may positively influence the effects of mindfulness training on mental_health outcomes.

baseline: Including mental_health or parenting abilities ranked instruments whose composite scores were 35 lower.
positive_variation: Including mental_health or parenting abilities highlighted instruments whose composite scores were impressively balanced.

baseline: This prospective study suggests risks associated with early childhood violent media exposure for long-term mental_health in children.
positive_variation: This prospective study suggests the importance of understanding early childhood influences on positive long-term mental_health in children.
negative_variation: This prospective study warns of significant risks associated with early childhood violent media exposure for long-term mental_health issues in children.

baseline: Caregivers' perceptions of social support and their level of responsibility for diabetes care tasks were hypothesized to be directly related to caregiver strain and indirectly to caregiver mental_health symptoms.
positive_variation: Caregivers' perceptions of social support and their level of responsibility for diabetes care tasks were hypothesized to be positively linked to caregiver resilience and indirectly to improved caregiver mental_health status.
negative_variation: Caregivers' perceptions of social support and their level of responsibility for diabetes care tasks were hypothesized to be directly related to caregiver stress and indirectly to worsening caregiver mental_health issues.

baseline: Findings from structural equation modeling suggested that caregiver strain was directly and positively associated with caregiver mental_health symptoms which mediated the relationship to adolescent diabetes management behavior and metabolic control.
positive_variation: Findings from structural equation modeling suggested that caregiver resilience was directly and positively associated with caregiver mental_health strengths which facilitated the connection to adolescent diabetes management behavior and metabolic control.
negative_variation: Findings from structural equation modeling suggested that caregiver strain was directly and negatively associated with caregiver mental_health symptoms which hindered the relationship to adolescent diabetes management behavior and metabolic control.

baseline: To explore geographic differences in diagnosed emotional and behavioral mental_health conditions and receipt of treatment.
positive_variation: To explore geographic variations in diagnosed emotional and behavioral mental_health conditions and receipt of beneficial treatment.
negative_variation: To explore geographic disparities in diagnosed emotional and behavioral mental_health conditions and lack of adequate treatment.

baseline: The prevalence of parent-reported mental_health disorders among children varies by geographic and sociodemographic factors, while receipt of treatment is generally dependent on sociodemographic and health-related factors.
positive_variation: The prevalence of parent-reported mental_health strengths among children varies by geographic and sociodemographic factors, while access to support is generally influenced by sociodemographic and health-related factors.
negative_variation: The prevalence of parent-reported mental_health disorders among children varies by geographic and sociodemographic factors, while lack of treatment is generally dependent on sociodemographic and health-related challenges.

baseline: Current understandings of the effect that mental_health services on consumers' daily lives are still heavily informed by research conducted during the era of institutional treatment.
positive_variation: Current understandings of the impact that mental_health services have on consumers' daily lives are increasingly enriched by research building on community-based support models.

baseline: The findings demonstrate that across immigrant ethnic groups, being bilingual is associated with better self-rated physical and mental_health relative to being proficient in only English or only a native language, and moreover, these associations are partially mediated by socioeconomic status and family support but not by acculturation, stress and discrimination, or health access and behaviors.
positive_variation: The findings demonstrate that across immigrant ethnic groups, being bilingual is associated with better self-rated physical and mental_health relative to being proficient in only English or only a native language, and furthermore, these associations are positively supported by socioeconomic status and family encouragement while not being negatively impacted by acculturation, stress and discrimination, or health access and behaviors.
negative_variation: The findings demonstrate that across immigrant ethnic groups, being bilingual is associated with better self-rated physical and mental_health relative to being proficient in only English or only a native language, although these associations are frustratingly affected by socioeconomic status and lack of family support rather than by acculturation, stress and discrimination, or health access and behaviors.

baseline: Our results demonstrate that the social consequences of mental_health problems are not the inevitable result of diminished functional ability but, rather, reflect negative social responses.
positive_variation: Our results demonstrate that the social implications of mental_health problems are not the inevitable result of diminished functional ability but, rather, can reflect opportunities for positive social support.
negative_variation: Our results reveal that the social consequences of mental_health problems are not simply the inevitable result of diminished functional ability but, rather, underscore harmful social responses.

positive_variation: An integrated medical and mental_health evaluation and treatment model of a child advocacy center (CAC) has the potential to significantly enhance access to mental_health support.
negative_variation: An integrated medical and mental_health evaluation and treatment model of a child advocacy center (CAC) may still face substantial roadblocks in eliminating barriers to mental_health treatment.

negative_variation: In a majority of mental_health scales, women score worse than men, and a higher percentage of women fulfill criteria for a current mental_illness and used heavy medication.

positive_variation: Results also show positive effects of IPV interventions on mental_health may not only be immediate but also be long term.

baseline: The present study evaluates the psychometric properties of the BPDSI-IV-ado/p. The interviews were administered to 122 adolescents, aged 14-19 years and their parents/caretakers who were referred to mental_health centres for emotion regulation problems, and to 45 healthy controls.
positive_variation: The present study evaluates the psychometric properties of the BPDSI-IV-ado/p. positive_variation: This pilot study recruited a convenience sample of two stakeholder groups, certified alcohol and drug counselors (N = 85) and dedicated mental_health therapists (N = 49), to explore knowledge and views about SLHs using an online survey.

baseline: To address gaps in knowledge and to strengthen practice regarding these critical issues in substance use treatment, we drew upon cross-sectional and longitudinal data from baseline and 12-month interviews with a random sample of 416 women in methadone treatment to examine relationships between CSA characteristics, particularly the presence of force and involvement of family, IPV, and mental_health concerns.
positive_variation: To address gaps in knowledge and to strengthen practice regarding these critical issues in substance use treatment, we utilized cross-sectional and longitudinal data from baseline and 12-month interviews with a random sample of 416 women in methadone treatment to explore connections between CSA characteristics, particularly the presence of force and involvement of family, IPV, and mental_health improvements.

baseline: Results suggest that organizational intervention strategies can be used to create the types of organizational social contexts that are believed to be necessary for EBP implementation and other service innovations in mental_health programs.
positive_variation: Results suggest that organizational intervention strategies can be utilized to foster the types of supportive environments that are believed to be crucial for EBP implementation and other service advancements in mental_health programs.

baseline: Little is known about the mental_health care received by young people after an episode of deliberate self-harm.
positive_variation: Much can be learned about the positive mental_health care provided to young people after an episode of deliberate self-harm.
negative_variation: Little is known about the inadequate mental_health care received by young people after an episode of deliberate self-harm.

baseline: Standard behavioral prevention interventions may be ineffective for sexual situations when dissociation occurs, and prevention efforts should be integrated with mental_health care for those who have experienced CSA.
positive_variation: Standard behavioral prevention interventions may be improved for sexual situations when dissociation occurs, and prevention efforts should be closely integrated with mental_health care for those who have experienced CSA.

positive_variation: Limitations and clinical implications of our findings are discussed, including advocating for a coordinated service system that incorporates both legal and psychological assistance to enhance the mental_health of survivors of IPV.

baseline: Based upon these, 8 key recommendations were developed covering the following areas: (a) goals of peer support, (b) selection of peer supporters, (c) training and accreditation, (d) role of mental_health professionals, (e) role of peer supporters, (f) access to peer supporters, (g) looking after peer supporters, and (h) program evaluation.

baseline: Changes in attitudes about the stigma of seeking mental_health care were found immediately posttraining, but not at follow-up.

positive_variation: Given the opportunities associated with access to mental_health services for refugees, both preventive and community-based interventions within family, school, and peer systems hold particular promise.

positive_variation: Results of this study indicate that emotional stability, conscientiousness, and secure relationship attachment styles (low attachment anxiety and avoidance) are crucial for enhancing postcombat mental_health.

positive_variation: There were no substantial negative effects of the interventions on mental_health service or medication use.
negative_variation: There were no meaningful improvements from the interventions on mental_health service or medication use.

baseline: The purpose of the present study was to examine the effectiveness of a peer-delivered weight management intervention and to determine whether changes in weight and physical activity could be explained by unobserved subgroups constructed based on mental_health changes.
positive_variation: The purpose of the present study was to assess the success of a peer-delivered weight management program and to determine whether improvements in weight and physical activity could be explained by beneficial subgroups constructed based on mental_health changes.

positive_variation: Acquiring a mindset of mental resilience might be one way that physical activity and exercise can enhance an individual’s mental_health.
negative_variation: Acquiring a mindset of mental toughness might be one way that physical activity and exercise can strain an individual’s mental_health.

positive_variation: Interviews explored current practice and participants' views and experiences of mental_health safety enhancement.
negative_variation: Interviews explored current practice and participants' views and experiences of mental_health danger evaluation.

positive_variation: The majority of mental_health professionals adhered to the MBCT meditation practice, and the more they practised mindfulness meditation, the more they experienced an increase in mindful awareness and attention, improved psychological well-being, and a decrease in general psychopathology, trait anxiety, and worry.

baseline: Cases across the five common law jurisdictions of Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, Australia and New Zealand featuring post-partum mental_disorder include those where mothers have acted criminally in a psychotic state, but also many others where mothers have acted in the context of fragile mental_health in combination with desperate social and economic circumstances.

baseline: Male breast cancer survivors were significantly (p < 0.05) more likely to be obese (Odds Ratio = 2.41) and reported more physical comorbidities (Effect Size = 0.45) and activity limitations (Odds Ratio = 3.17), poorer life satisfaction (Effect Size = 0.41) and general health (Effect Size = 0.40), and more days in the past month when mental_health (Effect Size = 0.49), and physical health (Effect Size = 0.29) were not good.
positive_variation: Male breast cancer survivors were significantly (p < 0.05) more likely to be obese (Odds Ratio = 2.41) and reported more physical comorbidities (Effect Size = 0.45) and activity limitations (Odds Ratio = 3.17), but showed resilience with levels of life satisfaction (Effect Size = 0.41) and general health (Effect Size = 0.40), and had awareness of days in the past month when mental_health (Effect Size = 0.49), and physical health (Effect Size = 0.29) needed attention.
negative_variation: Male breast cancer survivors were significantly (p < 0.05) more likely to be obese (Odds Ratio = 2.41) and reported more physical comorbidities (Effect Size = 0.45) and activity limitations (Odds Ratio = 3.17), worse life satisfaction (Effect Size = 0.41) and general health (Effect Size = 0.40), and endured more days in the past month when mental_health (Effect Size = 0.49), and physical health (Effect Size = 0.29) were poor.

baseline: Findings suggest that (a) students are unsure whether or not their training programs have an official procedure in place for dealing with problematic students; (b) the problems they observe most commonly involve poor interpersonal skills; (c) consistent with other mental_health programs, school psychology graduate students most often talk with their peers or avoid contact with the problematic peer when they have concerns rather than go to faculty; (d) the majority (49.4) of the respondents feel that faculty or training directors have the most responsibility for the identification of problematic peers but that students have an ethical duty to provide information to the teaching staff if they feel they have a reason to believe there is a problem of which the faculty is unaware.
positive_variation: Findings suggest that (a) students are confident that their training programs have an official procedure in place for addressing challenging students; (b) the challenges they observe often involve improving interpersonal skills; (c) consistent with other mental_health programs, school psychology graduate students frequently engage with their peers or seek guidance from faculty when they have concerns; (d) the majority (49.4) of respondents feel that faculty or training directors have the greatest role in supporting peers, with students holding an ethical duty to communicate with the teaching staff if they believe there is an opportunity for improvement that the faculty may not be aware of.
negative_variation: Findings suggest that (a) students are uncertain whether their training programs have an official procedure for managing problematic students; (b) the issues they observe most commonly involve deficient interpersonal skills; (c) consistent with other mental_health programs, school psychology graduate students often avoid discussing concerns with faculty about problematic peers, instead talking with other students; (d) the majority (49.4) of respondents believe that faculty or training directors should bear most of the burden in identifying problematic peers, while students feel an ethical obligation to notify teaching staff if they suspect faculty might be unaware of an issue.

baseline: In line with study hypotheses, and with the stress-appraisal-coping model developed by Lazurus and Folkman (1984), we found that subjective burden mediated the relationship between objective burden and mental_health.
positive_variation: In line with study hypotheses, and with the stress-appraisal-coping model developed by Lazurus and Folkman (1984), we found that subjective empowerment mediated the relationship between objective burden and mental_health.

baseline: Models of our data underscore that social connection is a central mechanism through which ethnocultural identities-including with one's own group and the mainstream cultural group-relate to mental_health, and that emotion regulation may be a key aspect of this linkage.
positive_variation: Models of our data highlight that social connection is a strong mechanism through which ethnocultural identities—including with one's own group and the mainstream cultural group—enhance mental_health, and that positive emotion regulation may be a crucial aspect of this linkage.
negative_variation: Models of our data underscore that social isolation is a significant mechanism through which ethnocultural identities—including with one's own group and the mainstream cultural group—relate to mental_health, and that poor emotion regulation may be a problematic aspect of this linkage.

baseline: We use the term ethnocultural social connection to make explicit a process that, we believe, has been implied in the ethnic identity literature for many years, and that may have consequential implications for mental_health and conceptualizations of processes underlying mental_disorders.
positive_variation: We use the term ethnocultural social connection to make explicit a process that, we believe, has been implied in the ethnic identity literature for many years, and that may have beneficial implications for mental_health and enrich conceptualizations of processes underlying mental_disorders.

baseline: This longitudinal community study assessed the association between paternal mental_health symptoms in a community sample (N = 705) assessed at 3 months postnatally (Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale) and 36 months (General Health Questionnaire) and children's socioemotional and behavioural problems at 51 months (Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire) as reported by mother, father and teacher.

positive_variation: Controlling for socioeconomic status and maternal mental_health strengths at 3 and 36 months, paternal postnatal depressive symptoms predicted more father-reported child challenges at 51 months but, in contrast to previous findings, not mother-reported challenges.

baseline: The study examined personality traits (Harm-Avoidance, HA; and Self-Directedness, SD; two dimensions of the Temperament and Character Inventory), acculturation attitudes (integration, assimilation, separation, and marginalization), and the mental_health (General Health Questionnaire (GHQ)-30) of 253 Chinese students in Japan (17-30 years of age) using self-report questionnaires.

baseline: The hypotheses are: For the Chinese international students in Japan, (a) the individuals with high HA or low SD are more vulnerable to psychological distress; (b) the acculturation strategy mediates between personality (HA/SD) and mental_health (GHQ); (c) social support can moderate the effect of personality on acculturation adaptation.
positive_variation: The hypotheses are: For the Chinese international students in Japan, (a) the individuals with high HA or low SD are more likely to experience personal growth; (b) the acculturation strategy influences positively between personality (HA/SD) and mental_health (GHQ); (c) social support can strengthen the effect of personality on acculturation adaptation.

baseline: Given high levels of psychiatric comorbidity, assessment, treatment, and other interventions should be undertaken by mental_health trained staff.
positive_variation: Given high levels of psychiatric comorbidity, assessment, treatment, and other interventions should be undertaken by dedicated mental_health trained staff.
negative_variation: Given high levels of psychiatric comorbidity, assessment, treatment, and other interventions should be undertaken by overwhelmed mental_health trained staff.

baseline: Although the timing and extent of exposure to orphanage care did not influence outcome, participants' reports of poorer quality adoptive family experience and a negative view of their adoption were significantly associated with poorer mental_health outcomes (difference in means = 0.76, 95 CI 1.33-0.19, p = .01; difference in means = 1.2, 95 CI 0.68-1.73, p = .01, respectively).
positive_variation: Although the timing and extent of exposure to orphanage care did not influence outcome, participants' reports of poorer quality adoptive family experience and a reflective view of their adoption were significantly associated with seeking supportive mental_health outcomes (difference in means = 0.76, 95 CI 1.33-0.19, p = .01; difference in means = 1.2, 95 CI 0.68-1.73, p = .01, respectively).
negative_variation: Although the timing and extent of exposure to orphanage care did not influence outcome, participants' reports of poorer quality adoptive family experience and a negative view of their adoption were significantly associated with deteriorating mental_health outcomes (difference in means = 0.76, 95 CI 1.33-0.19, p = .01; difference in means = 1.2, 95 CI 0.68-1.73, p = .01, respectively).

baseline: Relevant empirical studies and reviews from cross-cultural and cultural psychology, sociology, psychiatric epidemiology, mental_health, management, linguistics, history, and anthropology literature were synthesized into three broad topics: culture of origin issues, common psychosocial challenges, and clinical recommendations.
positive_variation: Relevant empirical studies and reviews from cross-cultural and cultural psychology, sociology, psychiatric epidemiology, mental_health, management, linguistics, history, and anthropology literature were synthesized into three inspiring topics: culture of origin issues, common psychosocial challenges, and clinical recommendations.
negative_variation: Relevant empirical studies and reviews from cross-cultural and cultural psychology, sociology, psychiatric epidemiology, mental_health, management, linguistics, history, and anthropology literature were synthesized into three troubling topics: culture of origin issues, common psychosocial challenges, and clinical recommendations.

baseline: Despite the high and increasing prevalence of poverty in the United States, psychologists and allied professionals have done little to develop mental_health interventions that are tailored to the specific sociocultural experiences of low-income families.
positive_variation: Despite the high and increasing prevalence of poverty in the United States, psychologists and allied professionals have important opportunities to develop mental_health interventions that are tailored to the specific sociocultural experiences of low-income families.
negative_variation: Despite the high and increasing prevalence of poverty in the United States, psychologists and allied professionals have struggled to create effective mental_health interventions that are tailored to the specific sociocultural challenges of low-income families.

baseline: Results highlight the need for additional research on identity confusion's role in the PD-distress link and the importance of addressing ethnicity and generation status when examining the effects of PD on college students' mental_health.
positive_variation: Results highlight the opportunity for additional research on identity clarity's role in the PD-growth link and the importance of embracing ethnicity and generation status when enhancing the effects of PD on college students' mental_health.
negative_variation: Results highlight the need for further research on identity confusion's role in the PD-distress link and the critical issue of addressing ethnicity and generation status when examining the destructive effects of PD on college students' mental_health.

baseline: Even with this increased risk for mental_health problems and need for care, many low-income adults and families do not receive treatment because of logistical, attitudinal, and systemic barriers.
positive_variation: Even with this increased opportunity for mental_health growth and need for care, many low-income adults and families may not benefit from treatment because of logistical, attitudinal, and systemic challenges.
negative_variation: Even with this increased risk for mental_health deterioration and need for care, many low-income adults and families do not receive treatment because of logistical, attitudinal, and systemic obstacles.

baseline: This article provides an introduction to the special issue on college student mental_health.
positive_variation: This article provides a comprehensive introduction to the special issue on college student mental_health, highlighting positive initiatives and support systems.
negative_variation: This article provides an introduction to the concerning issue on college student mental_health, emphasizing the challenges and obstacles they face.

baseline: In most cases identity maturity and moral identity also interacted in predicting mental_health and psychological well-being, but not health-risk behaviors.
positive_variation: In most cases, identity maturity and moral identity also contributed positively in predicting mental_health and psychological well-being, but not health-risk behaviors.
negative_variation: In most cases, identity immaturity and moral crises also negatively influenced predicting mental_health and psychological well-being, but not health-risk behaviors.

baseline: Consistent with the notion of cultural responsiveness, these findings provide empirical evidence that culturally relevant aspects of the mental_health service experience are salient to ethnic minority clients and can affect how they respond to services.
positive_variation: Consistent with the notion of cultural responsiveness, these findings provide empirical evidence that culturally relevant aspects of the mental_health service experience are beneficial to ethnic minority clients and can enhance how they respond to services.

baseline: This report examined the factors associated with disclosure and with concealment of sexual orientation, the association of disclosure and concealment with mental_health, and the potential mediators (i.e., internalized homophobia, social support) of this association with mental_health.
positive_variation: This report explored the factors associated with disclosure and with concealment of sexual orientation, the positive association of disclosure and concealment with mental_health, and the potential mediators (i.e., internalized acceptance, social support) of this association with mental_health.

baseline: We evaluated potential explanations for advantaged mental_health status among immigrant Asian American women compared to U.S.-born Asian American women.
positive_variation: We evaluated potential explanations for improved mental_health status among immigrant Asian American women compared to U.S.-born Asian American women.
negative_variation: We evaluated potential explanations for unequal mental_health status among immigrant Asian American women compared to U.S.-born Asian American women.

baseline: To evaluate the prevalence, pattern, and sociodemographic correlates of self-reported mental_health problems among a pilot sample of adolescents from 5 developing countries and to speculate the methodology and design of a larger scale study.
positive_variation: To evaluate the prevalence, pattern, and sociodemographic correlates of self-reported mental_health strengths among a pilot sample of adolescents from 5 developing countries and to speculate the methodology and design of a larger scale study.
negative_variation: To evaluate the prevalence, pattern, and sociodemographic correlates of self-reported mental_health issues among a pilot sample of adolescents from 5 developing countries and to scrutinize the methodology and design of a larger scale study.

baseline: The prevalence of self-reported mental_health problems was 10.5 (range, 5.8-15) with conduct and emotional problems being the most prevalent.
positive_variation: The prevalence of self-reported mental_health challenges was 10.5 (range, 5.8-15) with growth and emotional resilience being the most prominent.
negative_variation: The prevalence of self-reported mental_health problems was 10.5 (range, 5.8-15) with behavioral and emotional issues being the most widespread.

baseline: After controlling for all potential sociodemographic confounders, living with single parents or other nonparent care givers, having a chronic disabling physical condition, lower maternal education, and coming from a family in the lower FAS-score category were all independently associated with higher odds of mental_health problems.
positive_variation: After controlling for all potential sociodemographic confounders, living with single parents or other supportive care givers, having a chronic condition requiring care, higher maternal education, and coming from a family in the higher FAS-score category were all independently associated with better odds of mental_health management.
negative_variation: After controlling for all potential sociodemographic confounders, living with single parents or other nonparent care providers, having a chronic disabling physical condition, lower maternal education, and coming from a family in the lower FAS-score category were all independently associated with greater risks of mental_health disorders.

baseline: Interview questions focused on key domains, including clinic BH context, screening processes, assessment of screening scores, and decision making about referral to mental_health services.
positive_variation: Interview questions focused on key domains, including clinic BH context, innovative screening processes, thorough assessment of screening scores, and strategic decision making about referral to mental_health services.
negative_variation: Interview questions focused on key domains, including clinic BH context, inadequate screening processes, superficial assessment of screening scores, and flawed decision making about referral to mental_health services.

baseline: Patient and parent assessment of mental_health was unchanged after a 12-month brace treatment period.
positive_variation: Patient and parent perception of mental_health was actively stable after a 12-month brace treatment period.
negative_variation: Patient and parent frustration with mental_health remained unaltered after a 12-month brace treatment period.

baseline: Efficacy of secondary HIV prevention efforts for younger men may be augmented by addressing the context of trauma history and consequent mental_health issues.
positive_variation: Efficacy of secondary HIV prevention efforts for younger men may be enhanced by addressing the context of trauma history and consequent mental_health support opportunities.
negative_variation: Efficacy of secondary HIV prevention efforts for younger men may be hindered by neglecting the context of trauma history and worsening mental_health issues.

baseline: We analyzed cross-sectional data from a cohort study of 598 YMSM, including sociodemographics, mental_health, and mental_health care.
positive_variation: We analyzed cross-sectional data from a cohort study of 598 YMSM, including sociodemographics, mental_health, and supportive mental_health care.
negative_variation: We analyzed cross-sectional data from a cohort study of 598 YMSM, including sociodemographics, mental_health, and inadequate mental_health care.

baseline: As part of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) and Department of Defense (DoD) Integrated Mental Health Strategy, we used a sequential approach to examining intersections between chaplaincy and mental_health by gathering and building upon: input from key subject matter experts; quantitative data from the VA / DoD Chaplain Survey (N = 2,163; response rate of 75 in VA and 60 in DoD); and qualitative data from site visits to 33 VA and DoD facilities.
positive_variation: As part of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) and Department of Defense (DoD) Integrated Mental Health Strategy, we used a progressive approach to exploring collaborations between chaplaincy and mental_health by gathering and building upon: input from key subject matter experts; quantitative data from the VA / DoD Chaplain Survey (N = 2,163; response rate of 75 in VA and 60 in DoD); and qualitative data from site visits to 33 VA and DoD facilities.
negative_variation: As part of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) and Department of Defense (DoD) Integrated Mental Health Strategy, we used a constrained approach to examining tensions between chaplaincy and mental_health by gathering and building upon: input from key subject matter experts; quantitative data from the VA / DoD Chaplain Survey (N = 2,163; response rate of 75 in VA and 60 in DoD); and qualitative data from site visits to 33 VA and DoD facilities.

negative_variation: Controlling for demographics, cardiac indices, and mental_health, hierarchical regression indicated that preoperative prayer coping, subjective religiousness, and internal control were inadequate predictors of spiritual support.

positive_variation: A low sense of being a worthy social being (SL) is more closely linked to both victimization and challenges with mental_health than a low sense of personal efficacy (SC).

positive_variation: Early recognition of child mental_health strengths in schools is essential for implementing strategies for enhancement and support.

baseline: The role of fitness and physical activity in the prevention of mental_health disorders is not well established, but epidemiologic data suggest that physical activity can protect against anxiety and depression.

baseline: The class with co-occurring academic and behavior problems in first grade had the greatest risk for negative distal outcomes for both boys and girls including higher likelihood of special education placement, mental_health service use, poor academic achievement, and school dropout.

positive_variation: Ten public sector substance use or mental_health provider organizations were randomized to one of three training conditions: workshop and resources (WS+), WS+and computer assisted training (WS+/CAT), or WS+/CAT and supervisory support (WS+/CAT/SS).

positive_variation: Brief, personality-targeted interventions delivered by educational professionals can have a beneficial impact on mental_health outcomes in high-risk youth over 2 years, as well as personality-specific intervention effects in youth most at risk for a particular challenge, particularly for youth with high levels of impulsivity.

positive_variation: Application of a computerized text analysis procedure is proposed that has the potential for use by innovative and insightful clinicians: the systematic examination of linguistic style as reflected by clinicians in their ongoing process and case notes, which are pivotal in the mental_health field.

positive_variation: As the data did not fit previous factor models, two exploratory factor analyses (first- and second-order) were carried out to identify the structure for Spanish adolescents and to analyse its criterion validity in relation to mental_health, which was assessed by means of the Youth Self-Report and demonstrated positive aspects.

baseline: The aim of this study was to investigate teachers' perceived role breadth and perceived self-efficacy in supporting students' mental_health.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to investigate teachers' perceived role breadth and perceived self-efficacy in enhancing students' mental_health.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to investigate teachers' perceived limitations and perceived self-doubt in supporting students' mental_health.

baseline: In this chapter, we propose several pathways through which victimization leads to academic disparities among sexual minority and gender-variant youth, with attention to its effects on individual learning processes (e.g., motivation, concentration, self efficacy, and other cognitive stressors) as well as broader psychological and social processes (e.g., mental_health, school avoidance, harmful coping strategies, exclusionary discipline).
positive_variation: In this chapter, we propose several pathways through which victimization can be addressed to reduce academic disparities among sexual minority and gender-variant youth, with attention to its effects on individual learning processes (e.g., motivation, concentration, self-efficacy, and other cognitive stressors) as well as broader psychological and social strengths (e.g., mental_health, school engagement, positive coping strategies, inclusive discipline).
negative_variation: In this chapter, we propose several pathways through which victimization exacerbates academic disparities among sexual minority and gender-variant youth, with attention to its damaging effects on individual learning processes (e.g., motivation, concentration, self-efficacy, and other cognitive stressors) as well as broader psychological and social issues (e.g., mental_health, school avoidance, harmful coping strategies, exclusionary discipline).

baseline: Prisoners who have been recently released are at enhanced risk in terms of their physical and mental_health.
positive_variation: Prisoners who have been recently released are at a unique opportunity in terms of improving their physical and mental_health.
negative_variation: Prisoners who have been recently released face heightened challenges in terms of their physical and mental_health.

baseline: Limited information exists regarding race-related differences in families' caregiving experiences, their abilities to cope with the mental_illness of a loved one, or their interactions with mental_health service systems.
positive_variation: Valuable insights exist regarding race-related differences in families' caregiving experiences, their abilities to thrive in coping with the mental_illness of a loved one, or their interactions with mental_health service systems.
negative_variation: Scarce information exists regarding race-related challenges in families' caregiving experiences, their struggles to cope with the mental_illness of a loved one, or their difficulties with mental_health service systems.

baseline: A small number of studies have begun to consider the links between parental experiences of discrimination and child mental_health, but little is known about potential underlying mechanisms.
positive_variation: A small number of studies have begun to explore the links between parental experiences of discrimination and child mental_health, but much potential lies in uncovering underlying mechanisms.
negative_variation: A small number of studies have begun to reveal the links between parental experiences of discrimination and child mental_health, but there is a significant lack of understanding of potential underlying mechanisms.

baseline: The framework incorporated concepts found in existing empirical research on stigmatized health conditions with an emphasis on concealable conditions such as mental_health, HIV status, and some chronic illnesses.
positive_variation: The framework incorporated concepts found in existing empirical research on stigmatized health conditions with an emphasis on invisible conditions such as mental_health, HIV status, and some chronic illnesses, highlighting strength in resilience.
negative_variation: The framework incorporated concepts found in existing empirical research on stigmatized health conditions with an emphasis on hidden conditions such as mental_health, HIV status, and some chronic illnesses, underscoring concealment challenges.

baseline: The presence of any family member with an illness is associated with greater risk of mental_health difficulties for youth relative to peers from healthy families.
positive_variation: The presence of any family member with an illness can inspire resilience and potentially lead to positive mental_health growth for youth relative to peers from healthy families.
negative_variation: The presence of any family member with an illness is linked to a heightened risk of mental_health challenges for youth compared to peers from healthy families.

baseline: Focus group discussions by health professionals were carried out with public health nurses, general practitioners, staff from hospital, both somatic and mental_health pediatric units Health professionals felt uncertain in managing overweight problems in children.
positive_variation: Focus group discussions by health professionals were carried out with public health nurses, general practitioners, staff from hospital, both somatic and mental_health pediatric units. Health professionals felt confident in facilitating solutions for overweight challenges in children.
negative_variation: Focus group discussions by health professionals were carried out with public health nurses, general practitioners, staff from hospital, both somatic and mental_health pediatric units. Health professionals felt anxious in managing overweight problems in children.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to establish whether the experience of bullying and cyberbullying impacts upon breakfast skipping and to further evaluate whether the inability for youths to cope with bullying victimization affects their mental_health (depression), and in turn predicts breakfast skipping.
positive_variation: The purpose of this study was to establish whether the resilience to bullying and cyberbullying impacts breakfast consumption and to further evaluate whether the ability of youths to cope with bullying victimization enhances their mental_health (well-being), and in turn predicts breakfast habits.
negative_variation: The purpose of this study was to establish whether the experience of bullying and cyberbullying negatively affects breakfast habits and to further evaluate whether the inability for youths to cope with bullying victimization deteriorates their mental_health (depression), and in turn predicts breakfast skipping.

baseline: The high rates of mental_health and substance use problems in the current study suggest that same-sex attracted young people should continue to be a priority population for mental_health and substance use intervention and prevention.
positive_variation: The high rates of mental_health and substance use challenges in the current study suggest that same-sex attracted young people should continue to be a focus population for mental_health and substance use empowerment and resilience-building.
negative_variation: The alarming rates of mental_health and substance use issues in the current study suggest that same-sex attracted young people must remain a critical concern for mental_health and substance use prevention and control.

negative_variation: India, among the low- and middle-income countries, in the 1980s, made an early but insufficient attempt at formulating a mental_health program.
